intro: Aspidogyne sagrana, commonly known as the sacred aspidogyne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are opposite and elliptical, often with a slightly waxy texture. Aspidogyne sagrana is primarily found in humid lowland forests and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
